text: Hello team. Is there a HubL wat to `list the blog posts` that correspond to a `topic cluster`?
You can use property=tag to do that…
Hi! Yes, but that is for searching my words within the tag field. what i want is keeping searching within the posts content but only do it with posts that belong to one specific tag

<@UNU1C7MA7> I don't think so for topic clusters but if you tag your posts with a relevant topic then you could use this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-recent-tag-posts>
Does anyone know where I can find a snippet to add numbered pagination to a search results page? Seems easy enough but I don't want to reinvent the wheel.
On a related note, <@U7SL518D6> this link is broken in the dev docs: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/templates/system/search_results.html>
<@UDHT6N5SM> thanks, I was trying to avoid that path, because it seems redundant. The client would have to tag articles that already are identified in topics-clusters.
I ended up just building one, not HubL in any case.
You can always filter the results before printing them… not ideal though.
yes, i've tought about it but there could be a problem with pagination
